abstract: More individual investors have been turning to passive investing or index funds, which attempt to match the performance of main stock and bond markets; pension funds have been slow to embrace these investments despite fact they are often outperformed by them; resistance, particularly in public sector, is likely due to small army of asset managers who would no longer be needed if pension plans turned to index funds.
lead_paragraph: As more individuals pour money into index funds, institutions like pension funds and endowments have been slower to follow suit.

headline.main: Pension Funds Trail Individuals in Embracing Index Funds
headline.print_headline: Pension Funds Trail Individuals in Embracing Index Funds

snippet: As more individuals pour money into index funds, institutions like pension funds and endowments have been slower to follow suit.
